briefdescription.para: Maximum extra space needed for alignment.

detaileddescription.para: The ArchAlignMemorySize() can increase the required memory by no more than ARCH_MAX_ALIGNMENT_INCREASE.

briefdescription.para: The size of a CPU cache line on the current processor architecture in bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Requests to malloc() or ::new for a given size are often rounded upward. Given a request for nBytes bytes of storage, this function returns the amount that would actually be consumed by the system to satisfy it. This is needed for efficient user-defined memory management.

briefdescription.para: Align memory to the next "best" alignment value.

detaileddescription.para: This will take a pointer and bump it to the next ideal alignment boundary that will work for all data types.
